chunk_analysis.page_text:
State of West Virginia, County of Brooke to-wit:

I, W. B. Brandwood Clerk of the County Court of said County, do certify that the foregoing writing bearing date of the 19 day of June 1912, with the certificate of acknowledgement thereto annexed, was presented for, and by me duly admitted to record in my office in my said county, as to the parties therein named, this 9th day of November 1912, at 9 o'clock A. M.

Teste:
W B Brandwood, Clerk.

THIS DEED, Made the 19th day of October in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred and twelve between Geo. T. Russell and Annie A. Russell his wife of the City of Wellsburg, Brooke County, West Virginia, Parties of the first part, and G. Thomas, party of the second part,

WITNESSETH: That in consideration of the sum of Twenty-Five Hundred Dollars, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the said parties of the first part do grant unto the said party of the second part the following described property, that is to say:

"All of two certain tracts of land situate in Cross Creek District, Brooke County, West Virginia. The first of said tracts of land being a part of what was formerly known as "Penn Wood" farm and is bounded and described as follows, to wit; Beginning at a white oak tree on line of lands of Thomas Brady, thence with said Brady's line South 29 1/4° West 17.7 poles to a stake, thence South 5° East 34.9 poles to a post, thence North 70 1/4° East 20.75 poles to a stake, thence North 85 1/2° East 28 poles to a stake in line of land conveyed by H. C. Lazear etux., to Dr. Schenritz, thence with said Schenritz's line North 4 1/2° East 28.6 poles to the place of beginning and containing Twelve (12) acres more or less and being the same land as conveyed to the said Geo. T. Russell by deed of Carlos Thomas et ux and of record in the office of the Clerk of the County Court of Brooke County, West Virginia by Deed Book number156, page 525 of the records of said county. There is also granted as appurtenant to the afore mentioned tract the right-of-way along the South side of the above described tract of land to the county road known as the River Road. Said right-of-way being 20 feet in width and is more particularly described and set forth in the above mentioned deed to which reference is hereby made.

The second tract herein conveyed is bounded and described as follows, to wit: Beginning at a post corner to lands of Thomas Brady, thence with land of said Thomas Brady South 27 1/4° East 15.2 poles to a large white oak, thence North with line of said Geo. T. Russell or his afore mentioned tract, South 4 1/2° East 28.6 poles to a post, thence North with said Russell's line North 85 1/2° East 29.3 poles to a post in a small ravine East of the spring, thence down said ravine South 70 1/2° East 4 poles to a post at the junction of the two branches of the said ravine, thence down the meanders of the run, and with the rear of lots facing on what is known as the head of said run at its junction with a larger run, thence up the North bank of the run last mentioned and 15 feet therefrom North 54 1/2° East 3.2 poles, thence South 28° East 4.3 poles, thence North 65 1/2° East 5 poles, thence South 39 1/4° East 3.7 poles, thence North 41° East 15.2 poles, thence North 51° East 14.7 poles, thence North 39 1/4° East 6.2 poles to a post, thence South 23 1/4° East

24.9 poles to a post in the original Cox line, and line of James Brannon, thence with said Brannon's line North 5 3/4° East 80.4 poles to the place of beginning and containing twenty (20) acres of land more or less and is the same property which was conveyed to the said Geo. W. Russell by deed of E. M. Carr et ux., bearing date the 1st day of April 1909, and recorded in Deed Book number 34, page 364 of the records of Brooke County, West Virginia to which reference is hereby made. There is also further conveyed by the said Geo. W. Russell and Annie A. Russell, grantors herein, to the said grantee John C. Campbell all the coal, oil and gas together with all rights and privileges underlying a Two and one-half (2 1/2) acre tract as sold off the first above mentioned tract by the said grantors herein to John C. Campbell and which is here in after mentioned and also all the coal, oil and gas underlying the public road and right-of-way hereinafter granted by the said Geo W. Russell and wife to Joseph Isinghood and which is also further mentioned.

There is however excepted from the above tracts herein conveyed a certain parcel of land containing approximately Two and one-half (2 1/2) acres as conveyed by the said grantors herein to John C. Campbell by their deed bearing date the 15th day of April, 1913 and appearing of record in Deed Book number 40, page 322 of the deed records of Brooke County, West Virginia to which reference is hereby given for a more particular description of said parcel.

There is also reserved a right-of-way hereby granted by the said grantors under an agreement executed by them on the 22nd day of April, 1913 to Joseph Isinghood and appearing of record in Deed Book number 40, page 329 to which for a more complete description of said right-of-way reference is hereby given.

And the said Geo. W. Russell and Annie A. Russell his wife hereby covenant with the said party of the second part that they will warrant generally the property hereby conveyed.

Witness the following signatures and seals:
Geo W. Russell (Seal)
Annie A. Russell (Seal)

STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA, COUNTY OF BROOKE, to wit:

I, C. E. Beeves, a Notary Public of the said county of Brooke do certify that Geo. W. Russell and Annie A. Russell his wife, whose names are signed to the writing above bearing date the 29th day of October, 1913, have this day acknowledged the same before me in my said county.

Given under my hand this 29th day of October, 1913.
C. E. Beeves
NOTARY PUBLIC
My commission expires Dec. 2nd, 1915.

State of West Virginia, County of Brooke, to-wit:
I, A. L. Brashear Clerk of the County Court of said County, do certify that the foregoing writing bearing date on the 29th day of October 1913, with the certificate of acknowledgement thereto, was presented for and by me duly admitted to record in my office in my said county as to the parties therein named, this 3rd day of November 1913, at 11:45 o'clock A.M.

Teste
A. L. Brashear, Clerk

Annie A. Russell (Seal)

STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA, COUNTY OF BROOKE, to wit:

I, C. E. Beeves, a Notary Public of the said county of Brooke do certify that Geo. W. Russell and Annie A. Russell his wife, whose names are signed to the writing above bearing date the 29th day of October, 1913, have this day acknowledged the same before me in my said county.

Given under my hand this 29th day of October, 1913.
C. E. Beeves
NOTARY PUBLIC
My commission expires Dec. 2nd, 1915.

State of West Virginia, County of Brooke, to-wit:

Teste
